text: Janina Altman (née Hescheles), 2 January 1931 – 24 July 2022) was a Polish- Israeli chemist, writer and a Holocaust survivor. She was born in Lviv. When Nazi Germany invaded Poland, she was sent to the Janowska concentration camp. She escaped from there in 1943. She later became a writer and a chemist, working for Weizmann Institute of Science, and also at the Technical University of Munich. Altman died on 24 July 2022, aged 91.ניצולת שואה ופעילה קומוניסטית ותיקה: נפטרה פרופ' ינינה אלטמן ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Israeli chemists Category:Naturalized citizens of Israel Category:Holocaust survivors Category:Academics of the Weizmann Institute of Science
title: Janina Altman
